workflow.name: Monitor competitor financial performance with Bright Data MCP, OpenAI & Google Sheets
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

This workflow automatically monitors publicly available competitor financial dataâ€”funding rounds, earnings, and SEC filingsâ€”and alerts your team to significant changes. Gain an edge by reacting to financial moves faster.

## Overview

Using Bright Data, the automation scrapes Crunchbase, press releases, and SEC Edgar filings. OpenAI extracts key figures (revenue, funding amount, valuation) and assesses the potential impact. Highlights are posted to Slack and stored in Airtable for long-term tracking.

## Tools Used

- **n8n** â€“ Drives the automation
- **Bright Data** â€“ Scrapes financial disclosure sites
- **OpenAI** â€“ Extracts numbers and generates insights
- **Slack** â€“ Sends real-time alerts
- **Airtable** â€“ Maintains a financial timeline database

## How to Install

1. **Import the Workflow** into n8n.
2. **Configure Bright Data** credentials.
3. **Set Up OpenAI** API key.
4. **Authorize Slack & Airtable**.
5. **Customize Competitor List & Thresholds** in the Set node.

## Use Cases

- **Competitive Intelligence**: Track rivalsâ€™ financial health.
- **Investor Relations**: Benchmark against peers.
- **Strategic Planning**: Identify acquisition targets.
- **Sales Enablement**: Time outreach after funding events.

## Connect with Me

- **Website**: https://www.nofluff.online
- **YouTube**: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
- **LinkedIn**: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
- **Get Bright Data**: https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25 (Using this link supports my free workflows with a small commission)

#n8n #automation #financialmonitoring #competitoranalysis #brightdata #openai #secfilings #fundingrounds #n8nworkflow #nocode

nodes.name: ðŸ”— Enter Yahoo Finance URL for Tesla
ðŸ¤– AI Agent: Scrape Tesla Financial Data

parameters.text:
=Please scrape the latest financial data for Tesla, Inc. (TSLA) from Yahoo Finance for the latest quarter available. 

Search URL : {{ $json.teslaURL }}

Include the following information:
- Revenue for the latest quarter.
- Total Income
- Total Expenses
- Earnings per Share (EPS) for the latest quarter.
-  net margin for the latest quarter.
- Profit (Net Income) for the latest quarter.

please dont give me tha summary of these above financial data.
Please provide a detailed breakdown of only  these above financial metrics nothing else.

nodes.name: ðŸ“Š Get Company Data from Google Sheets
ðŸ“§ Send Financial Comparison to Team

parameters.subject: Financial Comparison: Your Company vs Tesla, Inc. (TSLA)

parameters.content:
### ðŸ”¹ **SECTION 1: Start & Input Financial Data URL**

#### ðŸ§© Nodes:

* `ðŸ”˜ Trigger: Manual Start`
* `ðŸ”— Set Yahoo Finance URL for Tesla`

#### ðŸ’¡ What Happens:

1. **Trigger the Workflow:** You **manually start** the workflow by clicking the **execute button**.
2. **Input the URL:** You **enter the Yahoo Finance URL** for **Tesla** (e.g., `https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/TSLA/`) into the system to get the **latest financial data**.

#### âœ… Beginner Tip:

You donâ€™t need coding experience here. Just copy and paste the **Tesla** stockâ€™s Yahoo Finance URL into the form field, and the rest will be done automatically!

### ðŸ¤– **SECTION 2: AI Agent Fetching Financial Data**

#### ðŸ§© Nodes:

* `ðŸ¤– Agent: Scrape Yahoo Finance Data`

  * **Sub-Nodes Inside the Agent**:

    * `ðŸ§  Chat Model`: Requests financial data.
    * `ðŸŒ Bright Data MCP Client`: Scrapes the financial data from Yahoo Finance using the **â€œweb\_data\_yahoo\_finance\_businessâ€ tool**.
    * `ðŸ§¾ Parse Output`: Converts the raw data into **structured JSON** format.

#### ðŸ’¡ What Happens:

* The **AI Agent** asks the **Bright Data MCP Client** to scrape **Teslaâ€™s latest financial data** from the Yahoo Finance page.
* The **MCP Client** uses a tool named **â€œweb\_data\_yahoo\_finance\_businessâ€** for this scraping process, ensuring that all information is pulled accurately, even if the site has protection mechanisms.
* The data is then **structured** into a readable **JSON format** for further processing.

#### âœ… Beginner Tip:

You donâ€™t need to manually scrape the data. The AI does it for you, and the tool ensures everything is clean and readable.

### ðŸ“Š **SECTION 3: Compare Tesla vs Your Companyâ€™s Financial Data**

#### ðŸ§© Nodes:

* `ðŸ“¥ Read Google Sheets (Teslaâ€™s Data)`
* `ðŸ”„ Compare Data with Your Companyâ€™s Data`

  * **Output Result:** â€œOutperformingâ€ or â€œUnderperformingâ€

#### ðŸ’¡ What Happens:

1. The workflow fetches your **company's financial data** from **Google Sheets**.
2. It compares **Teslaâ€™s financial data** with yours and then generates a comparison result like **â€œOutperformingâ€** or **â€œUnderperformingâ€**.

   This allows you to see whether Tesla is doing better or worse than your company in terms of performance metrics.

#### âœ… Beginner Tip:

The **comparison** is fully automated. If you input your company's data into **Google Sheets**, the workflow will automatically **compare it** to Teslaâ€™s data, saving you hours of manual work.

### ðŸ“§ **SECTION 4: Send Comparison Email to Team**

#### ðŸ§© Node:

* `ðŸ“§ Send Email via Gmail`

#### ðŸ’¡ What Happens:

Once the data comparison is complete, the workflow **automatically generates an email** and sends it to your team. This email contains:

* The comparison results of **Teslaâ€™s financial data vs. your companyâ€™s data**.
* A simple analysis of **how your company is performing relative to Tesla**.

#### âœ… Beginner Tip:

You donâ€™t need to draft an email. The workflow will send an **automated email** with the comparison results and save you from the hassle of manually updating your team.

### ðŸš€ **Tesla Financial Performance Scraper Workflow**

This workflow automates the process of **scraping financial data from Yahoo Finance for Tesla**, comparing it with your company's performance, and then sending the results to your team. Letâ€™s break down the sections for **easy understanding**!

---

### ðŸ”¹ **SECTION 1: Start & Input Financial Data URL**

#### ðŸ§© Nodes:

* `ðŸ”˜ Trigger: Manual Start`
* `ðŸ”— Set Yahoo Finance URL for Tesla`

#### ðŸ’¡ What Happens:

1. **Trigger the Workflow:** You **manually start** the workflow by clicking the **execute button**.
2. **Input the URL:** You **enter the Yahoo Finance URL** for **Tesla** (e.g., `https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/TSLA/`) into the system to get the **latest financial data**.

#### âœ… Beginner Tip:

You donâ€™t need coding experience here. Just copy and paste the **Tesla** stockâ€™s Yahoo Finance URL into the form field, and the rest will be done automatically!

---

### ðŸ¤– **SECTION 2: AI Agent Fetching Financial Data**

#### ðŸ§© Nodes:

* `ðŸ¤– Agent: Scrape Yahoo Finance Data`

  * **Sub-Nodes Inside the Agent**:

    * `ðŸ§  Chat Model`: Requests financial data.
    * `ðŸŒ Bright Data MCP Client`: Scrapes the financial data from Yahoo Finance using the **â€œweb\_data\_yahoo\_finance\_businessâ€ tool**.
    * `ðŸ§¾ Parse Output`: Converts the raw data into **structured JSON** format.

#### ðŸ’¡ What Happens:

* The **AI Agent** asks the **Bright Data MCP Client** to scrape **Teslaâ€™s latest financial data** from the Yahoo Finance page.
* The **MCP Client** uses a tool named **â€œweb\_data\_yahoo\_finance\_businessâ€** for this scraping process, ensuring that all information is pulled accurately, even if the site has protection mechanisms.
* The data is then **structured** into a readable **JSON format** for further processing.

#### âœ… Beginner Tip:

You donâ€™t need to manually scrape the data. The AI does it for you, and the tool ensures everything is clean and readable.

---

### ðŸ“Š **SECTION 3: Compare Tesla vs Your Companyâ€™s Financial Data**

#### ðŸ§© Nodes:

* `ðŸ“¥ Read Google Sheets (Teslaâ€™s Data)`
* `ðŸ”„ Compare Data with Your Companyâ€™s Data`

  * **Output Result:** â€œOutperformingâ€ or â€œUnderperformingâ€

#### ðŸ’¡ What Happens:

1. The workflow fetches your **company's financial data** from **Google Sheets**.
2. It compares **Teslaâ€™s financial data** with yours and then generates a comparison result like **â€œOutperformingâ€** or **â€œUnderperformingâ€**.

   This allows you to see whether Tesla is doing better or worse than your company in terms of performance metrics.

#### âœ… Beginner Tip:

The **comparison** is fully automated. If you input your company's data into **Google Sheets**, the workflow will automatically **compare it** to Teslaâ€™s data, saving you hours of manual work.

---

### ðŸ“§ **SECTION 4: Send Comparison Email to Team**

#### ðŸ§© Node:

* `ðŸ“§ Send Email via Gmail`

#### ðŸ’¡ What Happens:

Once the data comparison is complete, the workflow **automatically generates an email** and sends it to your team. This email contains:

* The comparison results of **Teslaâ€™s financial data vs. your companyâ€™s data**.
* A simple analysis of **how your company is performing relative to Tesla**.

#### âœ… Beginner Tip:

You donâ€™t need to draft an email. The workflow will send an **automated email** with the comparison results and save you from the hassle of manually updating your team.

---

## âœ… **Summary: How You Can Use This Workflow**

| Use Case                                | How It Helps You                                                                      |
| --------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ðŸ“Š **Financial Performance Comparison** | Instantly compare Teslaâ€™s data to your companyâ€™s financials.                          |
| ðŸ” **Competitive Analysis**             | Analyze how Tesla is performing in comparison to your business in key metrics.        |
| ðŸ“ˆ **Report Automation**                | Get **automated reports** on your company's performance relative to industry leaders. |
| ðŸ’¡ **Decision Making**                  | Take informed decisions based on **real-time financial data comparisons**.            |
